intro: Croixia pseudocuneata, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or streamside habitats. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, showy blooms during the summer months. Croixia pseudocuneata is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens.
